intro: Muscari pallens, commonly known as the pale musk mallow, is a bulbous perennial plant native to southern Europe. It produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue, typically blooming in early spring. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and is often found in woodland areas or along streambanks. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens. The bulbs are also used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
